lead_paragraph: He implied that the decision by James B. Comey to announce the discovery of new emails possibly related to the Hillary Clinton case had violated investigative norms.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin and Gardiner Harris reported from Chapel Hill, and Adam Goldman from Washington. William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting from New York, and Matt Apuzzo and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington.
byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN, ADAM GOLDMAN and GARDINER HARRIS

headline.print_headline: President Faults F.B.I. and Fires Up Clinton Faithful
headline.main: Obama Faults F.B.I. on Emails, Citing ‘Incomplete Information’

snippet: He implied that the decision by James B. Comey to announce the discovery of new emails possibly related to the Hillary Clinton case had violated investigative norms....
abstract: Pres Obama suggests in interview that FBI director James B Comey violated investigative norms and spread innuendo by sending vague letter to Congress about new emails related to Hillary Clinton's private server; urges college students at rally in North Carolina to vote in bid to galvanize both African-American and younger voters.
